summary: This is a September 20, 2019 letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, transmitting Deutsche Bank's ninth production of documents in response to a July 11, 2019 grand jury subpoena. The production includes Know Your Customer records, due diligence reports, and an 'Exit Letter' related to Jeffrey Epstein-affiliated accounts, and the letter asserts confidentiality and privilege protections.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Deutsche Bank AG, New York Branch and its affiliates, compelling the production of documents.

events.title: Deutsche Bank 'Exit Letter' to Epstein
events.description: Deutsche Bank transmitted an 'Exit Letter' to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, communicating the bank's intention to terminate its relationship with them.

events.title: Ninth Document Production to SDNY
events.description: Deutsche Bank's legal counsel transmitted the ninth batch of responsive documents to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, including KYC records and the 2018 Exit Letter.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was responding to a July 11, 2019 grand jury subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The document production included Know Your Customer (KYC) records, due diligence reports, photo IDs, and corporate documents for accounts affiliated with Jeffrey Epstein.
A key document produced was a December 21, 2018 'Exit Letter' from Deutsche Bank to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, notifying them of the bank's decision to terminate its relationship.
The letter strongly asserts that the production is confidential under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e) and does not waive any attorney-client privilege or other legal protections.
This was the ninth in a series of rolling document productions made by Deutsche Bank in response to the subpoena.
